replies.body: For supports it's fine having cheaper items due to having less gold income by default. ADC's, the supposedly "late game carries", having cheaper core AND full builds than mages, assassins, tanks and fighters? That is just bullshit.

I agree with this. For the longest time, marksmen being the game's carry class was somewhat justified by their builds costing the most gold, and their power being pretty low until they got 3-4 items' worth of synergistic stats. Currently, though, not only do many marksmen start spiking at 2 items, they also get to reach their core faster than any other non-support class. There is no justification for the power curve they enjoy now relative to everyone else.

Ultimately it boils down to one critical question: should marksmen be a carry class? If so, then they need to be balanced like actual carries, and go back to having terrible early game power and a curve that only spikes late. If not, then they should not collectively have access to nearly as much late-game power as they do now. Personally, I'm in favor of the latter, because I think trying to apply the same power curve to an entire class of champions is harmful to diversity, and often directly contradicts individual kits, where some champions are pretty much guaranteed to curve earlier or later than others. This applies to all other classes as well, who I think should have carries on par with marksmen in addition to early- and mid-focused champions, and because of this I think income and item costs need to be equalized across the board.
